metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1197 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
cpio 2.11, when using the --no-absolute-filenames option, allows local users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a file in an archive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpio - 2.11+dfsg-4.1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cpio package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.11+dfsg-4.1ubuntu1').
